ิฑึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีกึีธึีถีซีถ ีตีกีปีธึีคีธีฒ ีฟีกึีซีถีฅึีธึีถ ีซีถีน ีฆีกึีฃีกึีธึีดีถีฅึ ีกึีฑีกีถีกีฃึีธึีกีฎ ีฅีถ ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีกีทีญีกึีฐีซ ีดีงีป, ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีฅึีฏีซึีถีฅึีธึ ีดีซีปีฅึ ีตีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีซึีถีถีฅึีธึ ีฐีธีฌีธีพีธีตีฉีจ ีซีถีน ีบีกีฟีฏีฅึ ีฏีจ ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีง ีกีตีฝึ ึ, ีถีฅึีฏีกีต ีณีซีฃีฅึีจ ีดีซีป-ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีคีซึีกีถีกีฃีซีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีตีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีซึีถีถีฅึีจ ีฏีกึีฃีกึีธึีฅีฌีธึ ีธึีฒีฒีธึีฉีฅีกีดีข ีซีถีน ีกึีคีซึีถึีถีฅึีธึ ีฐีกีฝีกีฎ ีฅีถ,, ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีกีทีญีกึีฐ-ินีธึึึีซีก-ิปึีกีถ ีถีธึ ีฆีกึีฃีกึีธึีดีถีฅึีจ ีซีถีน ีถีทีกีถีกีฏีธึีฉีซึีถ ีธึีถีซีถ ีฐีกีตีธึีฉีฅีกีถ ีธึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฐีกีดีกึึ ิฑีตีฝ ีดีกีฝีซีถ ีีซีพีซีฌีถีฅีฉีซ ยซีึีธึยป ีฎึีกีฃึีงีถ ิฑีขึ ีีธีฒีซีฏีฅีกีถ ีฆึีธึึีฅึ ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีดีกีดีธึีฌีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีกีทีญีกีฟีธีฒ, ีฌึีกีฃึีธีฒ, ีฐึีกีบีกึีกีฏีกีฃีซึ, ีฃึีธีฒ, ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีกีทีญีกึีฐีซีถ ีฌีกึีกีฎีกีถึ ีฉ ินีธีดีกีฝ ิณีธึีฃีซีฝีฅีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟึ ีีฅึีฏีกีต ีฐีกีถีฃึีธึีกีถีซีถ ีดีซีป-ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีตีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีซึีถีถีฅึีธึ ีฆีกึีฃีกึีธึีดีจ ีฏีีจีถีฉีกีถีกีต ีกึีฅีฌีซ ีทีกีฟ ีพีถีกีฝีถีฅึีจ ีถีธึีกีฆีฅึีถีฅีฌีธึ, ึีกีถ ีฉีง ีกีผีฏีกีต ีฟีกีฃีถีกีบีถีฅึีจ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีฅีฌีซ ีคีกึีฑีถีฅีฌีธึ ีธึ ีกีถีธีถึ ีฌีธึีฎีธึีดีถีฅึ ีฃีฟีถีฅีฌีธึ ีฟึีกีดีกีขีกีถีธีขึีฉีฅีกีดีข, ีฏีีจีฝีง ิณีธึีฃีซีฝีฅีกีถึ ิถึีธีตึีจ ีจีถีคีฃึีฏีฅึ ีถีกีฅึ ีกึีกีขีกีฏีกีถ ีฅึีฏีซึีถีฅึีธึ ีดีงีป ีกีบึีธีฒ ีฐีกีต ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีถีฅึีจ ีฅึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีจี ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีถีฅึีฏีกีต ีซึีกีคีกึีฑีธึีฉีซึีถีถีฅึีธึ ีฌีธีตีฝีซีถ ีฟีกีฏึ

entry.title: Pashinyanโs solution will not bring peace, says former Armenian minister

media:group.media:title: Pashinyanโs solution will not bring peace, says former Armenian minister
media:group.media:description:
Artsakhโs parliament convened an extraordinary session today regarding Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyanโs remarks Monday, where the latter said he would accept Karabakh as part of Azerbaijan. Former Karabakh Presidents Arkady Ghukasyan and Bako Sahakyan, former Armenian Presidents Levon Ter-Petrossian, Robert Kocharyan and Serzh Sargsyan, as well as former Armenian Foreign Minister Vardan Osaknyan all released statements slamming Pashinyanโs remarks, and describing it is a gross violation of the Armenian Constitution.

entry.title: 2023 to be record-breaking year for tourism in Armenia

media:group.media:title: 2023 to be record-breaking year for tourism in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Sisian Boghossian, head of Armeniaโs Tourism Committee, sits down with CivilNet to discuss the countryโs latest tourism figures. Boghossian also talks about strategies to increase tourism, including a new direct flight to Saudi Arabia and a domestic tourism expo set to take place in Yerevan later this month.

entry.title: โWe have fallen, but we will rise. We cannot breakโ, Hon. Gassia Apkarian

media:group.media:title: โWe have fallen, but we will rise. We cannot breakโ, Hon. Gassia Apkarian
media:group.media:description:
Hon. Gassia Apkarian sits down with Lara Tcholakian to share her role and achievements as Judge of the Superior Court of Orange County in California, and the achievements that the Center for Truth and Justice (CFTJ) has made since the Artsakh war of 2020 in collecting evidence to be admissible in court.
Recently the CFTJ held its second international conference in Yerevan where various topics were raised including what it would mean for Armenia to become a member of the International Constitutional Court. Apkarian shares her story of how she was raised and educated in Lebanon, Syria and the US, and the values and qualities she acquired from her uprooted lifestyle in the diaspora. She also expresses her thoughts about the future of Armenia, as well as the importance of having hope and finding purpose in life. Finally, she shares the continuous battle and challenges she faces as a woman leader.
About Hon. Gassia Apkarian is a judge at the Superior Court of Orange County in California, a position she holds since 2014. Prior to that, she was a Senior Attorney and Deputy Public Defender in Orange County. After Armeniaโs earthquake in 1988, Apkarian moved to Armenia to volunteer with Land & Culture. She has been working as a volunteer in Armenia and has been returning to since then. She was Country Director for Armenia with the Armenia Assembly of America, Executive Director of โDemocrats 2000โ in Washington D.C. as well as Campaign Manager for Robert Kocharyan during the presidential elections in 1998, followed by Advisor to the President. She received a B.A. from the University of California โ Irvine, and a J.D. from the University of La Verne College of Law.
Program overview In a new open setting, Lara deconstructs inherited cultural and historical narratives, memories, life lessons and experiences from change catalysts. Her guests reflect on the stories, people, events and mindsets that have shaped their professional and personal lives, enabling them to create a more mindful life.
#CivilNet #MindfulLeaders #InheritedLegacies

ะฃ ะฐัะผัะฝัะบะธั ะฒะปะฐััะตะน ัะฐะบ ะธ ะฝะตั ะฟะปะฐะฝะฐ ะฟะพ ะบะฐัะฐะฑะฐั ัะบะพะผั ััะตะณัะปะธัะพะฒะฐะฝะธั. ะะฝะธ ะทะฐัะฒะปััั ะพ ะณะพัะพะฒะฝะพััะธ ะฟัะธะทะฝะฐัั ะะฐัะฐะฑะฐั ัะฐัััั ะะทะตัะฑะฐะนะดะถะฐะฝะฐ, ะฝะพ ัะตัะบะพ ะฝะต ะธะทะปะฐะณะฐัั ัะฒะพั ะฟะพะทะธัะธั ะพ ัะพะผ, ะบะฐะบ ะะฐะบั ะดะพะปะถะตะฝ ัะพะฑะปัะดะฐัั ะฟัะฐะฒะฐ ะธ ะฑะตะทะพะฟะฐัะฝะพััั ะบะฐัะฐะฑะฐั ัะตะฒ, ัะตะณะพ ััะตะฑัะตั ะัะตะฒะฐะฝ. ะขะฐะบะพะต ะผะฝะตะฝะธะต ะฒััะฐะทะธะปะฐ ััะฐััะธะน ะฐะฝะฐะปะธัะธะบ ะะตะถะดัะฝะฐัะพะดะฝะพะน ะบัะธะทะธัะฝะพะน ะณััะฟะฟั ะะปะตัั ะะฐััะฐะฝัะฝ ะฒ ะธะฝัะตัะฒัั CivilNet. ะะพ ะผะฝะตะฝะธั ะฐะฝะฐะปะธัะธะบะฐ, ะฒ ะฟัะพัะตััะต ะฐัะผัะฝะพ-ะฐะทะตัะฑะฐะนะดะถะฐะฝัะบะพะณะพ ััะตะณัะปะธัะพะฒะฐะฝะธั ัััะตััะฒะตะฝะฝัะผ ัะฐะณะพะผ ะฒะฟะตัะตะด ััะฐะฝะตั ัะฐะทะฑะปะพะบะธัะพะฒะบะฐ ะบะพะผะผัะฝะธะบะฐัะธะน, ะตัะปะธ ััะพัะพะฝะฐะผ ัะดะฐัััั ะดะพะณะพะฒะพัะธัััั ะฝะฐ ะฟะตัะตะณะพะฒะพัะฐั ะฒ ะะพัะบะฒะต 25 ะผะฐั.

ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีฐีกึึีธึีด ีฌีธึีฎีธึีดีจ ีธีน ีฉีฅ ีฆีซีปีธึีดีถ ีธึ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีบีกีฐีกีถีปีถีฅึีซ ีฏีกีฟีกึีธึีดีถ ีง, ีกีตีฌ ีธึีชีกีตีซีถ ีขีกีฌีกีถีฝีซ ีพีฅึีกีฏีกีถีฃีถีธึีดีจโค ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีถีทีธึีด ีง ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีพีฅึีฌีธึีฎีกีขีกีถ ีีซีฃึีกีถ ิณึีซีฃีธึีตีกีถีจ: ีึีก ีญีธีฝึีธีพี ิฑึึีกีญีซึ ีฐึีกีชีกึีพีฅีฌีธีพี ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซีถ ีฐีถีกึีกีพีธึ ีนีง ีฆีฝีบีฅีฌ: ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ, ีพีฝีฟีกีฐ ีง ีถีก, ีธึีคีฅีฃึีฅีฌ ีง ีฐีฅีฟึีตีกีฌ ีฃีธึีฎีฅีฌีกีธีณีจ` ีซึีกีพีซีณีกีฏีจ ีฐีกีฝึีถีธึีด ีง ีกีถีคีกีผีถีกีฌีซ ีฏีฅีฟีซ ีธึ ีกีฝีธึีดี ยซีคีฅ ีกีตีฌีจีถีฟึีกีถึ ีกีผีกีปีกึีฏีฅึยป:
